alert.note: Alert for Blair; Cambria; Huntingdon (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 19 at 8:05AM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...A BAND OF LOCALLY HEAVY SNOW WILL AFFECT PARTS OF BLAIR...CAMBRIA...AND HUNTINGDON COUNTIES... HAZARDS...A band of locally heavy snow, accompanied by winds of 20 MPH, which can rapidly reduce visibility to less than a quarter of a mile. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 800 AM EDT, a band of locally heavy snow was over central and northern Cambria and Blair counties, into western Huntingdon county. The band of snow was generally moving towards the east southeast. The most likely areas to see any snow accumulation on the roadways and localized slippery spots will be the higher elevation locations. LOCATIONS IMPACTED INCLUDE... Altoona, Hollidaysburg, Tyrone, Ebensburg, Nanty-Glo, Northern Cambria, Lakemont, Bellwood, Warriors Mark, Patton, Cresson, Gallitzin, Loretto, Hastings, Williamsburg, Duncansville, Tipton, Lilly, Carrolltown and Sankertown. This includes Interstate 99 from mile markers 26 to 51. SAFETY INFO... Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. &&
